result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 11, 2022 at 11:45 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Samantha R Crum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Samantha R Crum.  Prosecuting attorney Rose Marie Yanke in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court appoints Attorney Campbell Hunter in 22CM438.
This matter is being reset. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 11:00 am.
No contact w/victim or their residence - JAD, but can have telephone contact and contact through letters.

10:03 AM Defendant Samantha R Crum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Samantha R Crum.  Prosecuting attorney Rose Marie Yanke in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim appears in court and makes a statement regarding the bond modification.

Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Notice of Hearing
Bail/bond hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court appoints Attorney Shunette Campbell Hunter as counsel - Defendant must pay $50.00 per month toward attorney fees commencing September 1, 2022. Case 22CM438 was added to this on 10.21.2022
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Austin M Mogard in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samantha R Crum in court. Victim appeared in court by a Zoom call w/ JA.
Defendant states she didn't qualify for a public defender, court gives her the petition for a court appointed attorney form.
Sergeant Jazdzewski is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being employed with the City of Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. Testifies to having contact w/ JAD in the front of city hall. Testifies to seeing him sitting in the parking lot and stopped to ask if he was okay. Testifies to JAD contemplating on reporting his wife. Testifies to wanting to report her for beating him up. Testifies to statements made by JAD. Testifies to his wife being the defendant. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to scratch marks and bite marks on JAD. Testifies to JAD not wanting to report and the reasons.
Attorney Mogard requests the court take judicial notice.
Court can't bind this over for a felony because of the charges but will find probable cause for the misdemeanor charges. This matter will be set for a final pre-trial. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 12, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
No contact w/victim or their residence - JD.

9:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samantha R Crum in court. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be set for a preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is set.
